void PointGroup::addOperation ( boost::intrusive_ptr< SymmetryOperation >  op  ) 

Adds a new operation to the group. This creates a new point group class. Future versions should check if the class already exists.

Parameters:
op

Create all possible combinations of symmetry elements and verify that the groups is closed under multiplication.

bool PointGroup::hasOperation ( boost::intrusive_ptr< SymmetryOperation >  op  ) 

Check to see whether the operation exists in the point group. The check is done by numerically checking the 3x3 transformation matrices to see if they are equivalent within a numerical cutoff.

Parameters:
op The symmetry operation to check for
Returns:
If operation is part of point group
Exceptions:
Programming error if called before formClosedGroup is called to finish initialization.

void PointGroup::init_statics (  )  [static, private]

bool PointGroup::isTotallySymmetric ( VectorPtr  chars  ) 

Computes whether the set of characters contains a contribution from the totally symmetric irrep. This assumes the vector and the list of point group classes are aligned.

Parameters:
chars 
Returns:
If vec has totally symmetry irrep contribution

bool gigide::PointGroup::valid_ [private]

Whether the point group has been "closed", i.e. now new element can be created as products of current elements.
